Arnie tried again to read the map, looked past it at the roads up the hill on the other side of the valley, then down at the map again. His shoulder's slumped and he sat back on the bench by the road.

"Yeah. Totally lost." he muttered to himself. "Some adventure I am. Wonder what this village is called?" He added, peering down at the valley floor where the ivy covered buildings (all four of them that he could see) ran alongside the little river.

After some sighing, a little self-recrimination, and grumbling he stood up, shouldered his backpack and headed down the road (more of a wide path really) towards 'civilization.' He didn't get far. Only twenty feet from the old wooden bench by the gate he'd sat on, he tripped and tumbled into the hedge, curses echoing from the thrashing mess of twigs.

He struggled up, sitting there with twigs in his hair and gasped.

"Ow." He grunted, rubbing his bruised head and shoulder... then frowning. Looking down an odd, dirty brown piece of metal was around his neck, like an almost complete ring crudely made. It looked bent and battered, rusty in places, and with some of the obviously detailed knotting design that it was made with worn smooth in many spots.

"Huh?" He said, frowning down at it.

The thing had obviously got on him somehow, so why wasn't it coming off? He spun it around on his neck to look at the 'back' of it where there was a break in the ring, with two little balls on the edges of the break. The gap in the ring was only about an inch wide but there was no give in the thing at all. Solid metal.

"How the hell did this thing get on me?" He asked.

A faint 'Ping' happened, like an old time bell in a shoe shop or something, but it sounded echoy which seemed totally wrong in the open like this.

"Item acquisition is non-refusable and cannot be recinded. Please contact Elders for further information."

"Uh... wha?" That had sounded like it was in his head, more like a refined woman's voice, like a really old school mistress at a boarding school or something. Not that he'd been to one of those. "Uh, who are you?" He managed.

There was no reply.

Frowning at the odd ring Arnie thought about what happened before that voice happened, so...

"How did this ring get on my neck?"

Only crickets answered him.

"Oh come on! At least say something."

"Hello 'dere?"

Arnie jumped as the guy's voice came from behind him. He twisted around and saw a farmer leaning on a gate in the hedge a little ways from where he'd fallen.

"Uh... Hi. Is this thing yours? I fell in the hedge and... it won't come off."

The guy had a straw hat on, an old long stemmed pipe in one side of his mouth, and wearing a T-shirt with the words 'Farmers do it sun up to sun-down.' in red letters on the front. He frowned peering down at Arnie's neck.

"Don't 'tink so. It rare?"

Arnie frowned at him.

"How the heck would I know? I only just found it!"

"S'all right, don't get ya knickers in a twist lad. Just askin."

Arnie humphed and stood up, a little unsteadily.

"Uh, I'm kinda lost. What's the name of this town. Er, village?"

"Little Danninford." He said simply, puffing on his pipe.

"Ooookay. Er. Thank you." Arnie said, edging away from the odd man. "I'll... be heading out."

He turned and headed back up the hill the way he came, hoping he could find his way back to the bus stop.

"Strange lad." The farmer said. "But at least that darned thing's finally outta me' hair."

You were standing at your locker, searching frantically for you chemistry textbook that you were sure you'd left in there, when you suddenly heard a commotion going on further up the hallway. Looking round you saw three girls from the cheerleading squad pushing around a much smaller girl, laughing and taunting her. Peering over curiously, you suddenly realized that the small, skinny dark haired girl that was the object of amusement for the tall blonde cheerleaders was none other than Rebecca Taylor, the current object of your affections.

"Hey!" you called out, forgetting about your textbook and running down the hallway towards them, "Leave her alone!"

The three girls looked round at you and you recognized them immediatly as Misty Sullivan, Chloe Johnston and Andrea Smith; three of the most popular girls it the entire school. They were all tall and busty, with long flowing hair and beautifully made up faces, unfortunately they didn't have the personalities to match and had a reputation for being total bitches, always strutting around like they owned the school, treating everyone else like crap cause they weren't as popular or as good looking as them, or because they weren't dating members of the football team like they were.

"Oh, well looky looky who's come to little Becky's rescue," Misty laughed sarcastically, "If it isn't everyone's favorite nerd "Piss Pants" Peterson, watch out girls, he might wet himself again!"

They all burst into laughter as you approached them, looking down at Becca's frightened face, that stupid rumour that Gary Russel, Captain of the football team had spread about you peeing yourself in the gym changing rooms coming back to haunt you. "Get lost loser!" Chloe said, stepping iout in front of you with her imposing figure and pushing you hard, knocking you onto the floor.

"Leave him alone!" Becca cried out, causing the three girls attention to shift back to her.

"Hey, did we say you could talk, runt?" Misty said angrily, towering over her intimidatingly, causing Becca to recoil slightly. "You don't speak unless we say you can, got that? Now give me back that broach you stole."

"But it's mine! My Mom gave it to me!" Becca replied, tears forming in her eyes, as she cradled something in her hands.

"No, you stole it from Misty, now fucking give it back alright!" Andrea chimed in, clenching her fists.

You couldn't take anymore, seeing the distressed look on Becca's innocent little face, these three bitches treating her like absolute crap, trying to steal her stuff. Picking yourself up, you pushed your way between them and Becca, using your body as a shield to protect her. "You heard her; she's not giving you it! Now get lost and leave her alone!"

They looked at you with an expression of disbelief, which soon turned to patronizing laughter, amused someone considered a nerd by half the school would actually try and stand up to them. "Hah ha, that's hilarious, little "Pee Pants" here thinks he's some kind of hero." Misty laughed, stepping towards you, causing you to back away slightly, bumping up against Becca. "Well let me give you a bit advice dork, this little virgin isn't gonna put out for you if that's what you're thinking, I doubt she'd even know what to do with a cock if she saw one."

"Probably think it was some sort of monster and go crying to mommy!" Chloe added, causing the three of them to giggle manically like a coven of witches.

"Shut up! Just cause she's not a slut like you!" you shouted, unsure where you got the balls to say such a thing, pushing Misty, causing her to go stumbling back against a locker. The giggling stopped immediately and it felt as if the whole school suddenly went silent as you stood there utterly shocked at what you had just done, the rest of them wearing a similar expression.

"You little fuck!" Misty screamed, a look of pure venom appearing on her face. Shit, you were in for it now, knowing that you'd just crossed a line, you, a nerd, a nobody, had just pushed the head cheerleader, the most popular girl in school against a locker and you could tell by the look on her face that she wasn't just going to walk away and forget about it.

Thankfully, as Misty lunged towards you, you suddenly heard a voice shout from down the hallway, causing you all to freeze. "Misty Sullivan! What's going on over there?" Looking around you were relieved to see Mr. Matthews, the History teacher storming up towards you, a look of concern on his withered face. The three girls immediately backed away from you, and turned to face the teacher.

"Nothing sir, we were just talking that's all," Misty lied innocently, hands behind her back, chest thrust out to distract him (a tactic they seemed to use often to wrap people around their little fingers).

"Peterson is that correct?" he asked, as the three girls glared menacingly at you.

You wanted to tell him that it wasn't, that those three bitches had been harassing Becca, trying to steal her stuff, but you knew that even if he did believe you, the reprisal that both you and Becca would face from them, their friends and their jock boyfriend's would be terrifying. You'd become objects of torment around the school, and although you didn't want that to happen to you, you especially didn't want it to happen to Becca, caring a great deal about her well being, knowing that she already went through enough punishment as it is for being small, quiet and keeping herself to herself.

"No sir," you finally answered feebly, dipping your head.

"Alright then." Mr. Matthews said, accepting the obvious lie, "Well enough hanging around here. Get to class you lot, chop chop!" He clapped his hands for you to disperse and you watched as Misty and her cronies walked away, whispering quietly to you that, "this wasn't over" before disappearing out of sight. You then turned and looked down at Becca who was still shaking a little from the encounter, putting your hand on her shoulder to see if she was okay as Mr. Matthews continued to go about his business.

"You alright Becca?"

"Yeah...thanks to you David," she half smiled, picking up her fallen schoolbag from the ground. "I just wish those three dragons would leave me alone."

You stared down at her sweet little face, feeling total sympathy and pity for what she was going through. Even though you yourself were more than somewhat unpopular, Becca seemed to get an even worse time of it from the girls due to the way she looked. She was incredibly small and petite for a girl of sixteen, only around 4'10" where as people like Misty and Chloe were easily 5' 7" or taller, making her look like a little girl instead of a teenager, the fact that she was also flat chested and incredibly scrawny not helping much either. But she did have an incredibly cute face, big blue eyes hidden behind glasses, a small patch of light orange freckles across her small button nose with short black hair held back by a light pink hair band, her small body always dressed conservatively in a white shirt, sleeveless black sweater, red tartan skirt, black knee length socks and a pair of dainty little black sandals, hardly most people's idea of a dream girl, but you were smitten with her. To you she was the most beautiful, most kind and sincere person in the entire school, and being an outcast like you made you both all the more well suited. Unfortunately as of yet you were still firmly just good friends.

"Hee hee, I can't believe you actually pushed Misty," she giggled as you walked down the corridor towards your next class.

"Yeah, me neither," you admitted still worried that it would come back to haunt you. "Now c'mon, lets get to chemistry huh?"

OK, here I'll give a little info on the stup of the first page of the quick stories, nothing too complicated.


Story Name(optional)
Small description of main characters
Type of story(fetish/sexuality/rating){only need one of these choices, put in the type of fetish, if you don't have a certain sexuality chosen, sexuality if you have no fetish chosen/in it, and rating if you don't want to use either of the other two}
Setting


And that's pretty much it, add any info you want to that, or just have the stuff that isn't optional, that's all there is to starting a quick story in this interactive (easier than hunting through tons of choices huh?)
15.title: Quick Story, basic setup

151.content:
So, random fact about me (that no one probably cares about), when I'm bored I generally choose a setting at random, and make a random story out of it. It's just a thing to pass time while I have nothing better to do, and I never write them down. It's all in my head. I add to it as time goes by, and usually give myself a SINGLE op ability. I continue 'til I start getting bored with it, or running out of ideas. This is the basic setting of the one I most recently started.

Name: World Tamer
Main character: Me (you, whoever, just some random guy representing the reader)
Type of story: Main fetish would be Mind Control, though pretty much anything goes beyond that, depending on circumstances.
Setting: You're a relatively intelligent inventor/scientist working on your dream invention, a size ray. It could change the world! World hunger? Giant food! Overpopulation? Make areas where people live in small houses to save space. Etc.

However, while struggling to figure out the theoretical sciences required, the world around you shifts to a forest, a strange woman standing next to you, holding your unfinished ray! She claims she's a 'Goddess' and has found your project to be interesting. She claims that this world is full of magic and monsters. And, with the proper use of magic, which can be condensed into crystals, allowing the transfer of skills, your ray is no longer a dream! Giving you a blessing, in the form of a special skill, and teaching you how to 'check your status', as she put it, she disappears.

Checking your status, a holographic menu you could only describe as 'being from an RPG' pops up, and shows a 3D model of yourself, as well as a list of skills. The one that catches your attention the most is 'Taming'.
151.title: Isekai is a cool genre of manga

choices: Hail them, see if they'll give you a ride.
Let them pass. You'd prefer to do things alone for now.
1511.content:
(With that done, I'm not planning on really adding to this, it's sort of an example of how the 'Quick Story' options work. Feel free to let this hang, or add to it yourself. Here's a tiny bit more world building for my version.)

Upon closer inspection, it seems you have quite a few skills. First are some basic skills, Average Strength, Average Agility, Average Dexterity, High Intelligence, Good Magic Affinity, Dubious Luck. The general stuff you would expect, given the RPG feel you got earlier, more stats, than skills, though there are no numbers, so it's hard to tell just how high they actually are.

Second are some less obvious skills. Magic Knowledge: None, which seems to be how well you know magic, perhaps it goes up as you learn new spells? A bunch of weapon proficiencies, Sword, Axe, Spear, Unarmed, etc.

And finally, there are 4 skills that really catch your attention. Sense Hostility, Auto-Translate (Passive), Taming, and Skill Evolution (Passive). You can't check what each skill does, trying to touch the hologram-like display does nothing, and trying to check with mental commands doesn't seem to have any effect. If you had to guess, 3 of the 4 are pretty easy to understand, Sense Hostility would appear to be a 'search' sort of skill, meant to check for hostiles, after trying to activate it, it doesn't seem to do anything, perhaps nothing overtly aggressive is nearby?

Auto-Translate translates, you guess.

Next up is Taming, the one you're most interested in. It's pretty obvious what that should do, based on what the word usually means in this sort of situation, PETS! The ability to tame and control creatures. Sounds pretty fun to you.

And finally, Skill Evolution. The ability for skills to evolve? You have no idea what that might entail. Anyway, that's enough of that, time to look for civilization.

After a bit of wandering, you notice a mouse-like creature, that seems to be eating some berries. It doesn't seem to notice you. Deciding to test out your new ability, you try to activate the taming skill. After a bit, you get something right, and a bar appears above the mouse, in the bar, it has a number. 0%. A few moments later, it jumps to 10%, then 20, 30...Around this time, the creature seems to notice something. Spinning around, it gives a squeak, and seems to vanish, though the bar stays where it is, and continues to fill up.

Realizing the mouse is still there, you continue for a while. Around 50%, the mouse re-materializes, seeming to have calmed down. At 70% you attempt to get closer, and it doesn't seem to mind. At 80%, it even starts to be friendly, letting you pet, and hold it. Around this time, you feel it's okay to start relaxing, the mouse showing now sign of running off. Talking to yourself, you wonder about where you might find civilization.

A voice from slightly in front of you claims they know where other people live. With a start, you look at the source, the mouse! Of course! The translating skill! It translates even creatures cries! That's why you've been hearing voices this entire time!

As you're about to ask the mouse about it, the taming bar hits 90%, seems to stall for a few seconds, and then the mouse drops limp! Is it...?! No, it's breathing. Good. the bar is at 99% and doesn't seem to be changing. What now? What is the last step of the taming proc- OH! A name! Maybe...Leaning in a little, you tell the mouse 'I'll call you Minnie.' A famous mouse's name, and a description of it's size. And with that, the bar reads 'complete' before fading away. So, the last part is naming it. But why'd it faint? You'll have to figure that out later.

After a while, Minnie wakes up, allowing you to ask it some questions. First up, since you named it without knowing, you ask for it's gender, ready for that awkward 'I am male' moment. But it turns out, Minnie is, in fact female. Guess that's your 'Dubious Luck' at work?

Getting directions from her, you eventually arrive at a road, and start heading towards where she says a town is.

A little later, you hear a noise, which sounds like horses, with another sound you aren't quite sure about mixed in. Turning around, you see a wagon with two people riding your way. One a male human, looking rather average, over all. Not super impressive, but not a pushover, that's for sure. Next to him is a woman, of sorts. She appears to be a mix of human and animal, fox if you're not mistaken. Not quite the animal women you see in most RPGs/Anime, this one is a fully anthropomorphic 'furry' fox. It catches you off guard. Sure, you're in a fantasy world, but seeing a non-human for the first time is still a bit strange. You'd be willing to bet on elves, dwarves, and all the other fantasy creatures being a thing as well.

They're heading your way, what will you do?
1511.title: Continue

choices: Note for those continuing this story-line.
Note for those continuing this story-line.
15111.content:
Well, they are going the same direction you are, so you wave them down. Hoping they're willing to stop for a total stranger. Surprisingly, they are! Coming to a stop, they greet you. You ask if they'd be willing to let you ride with them to the town and get a friendly welcome. Climbing on board, they notice Minnie poking her head from your shirt pocket for the first time, leading to a few questions. You explain your situation, how you were brought here by a 'goddess', and have a skill to tame things, not expecting them to believe you.

Once again, they surprise you. They believe you, and seem genuinely concerned/excited, mentioning that they've heard of this once or twice. Deciding to get more information, you start asking questions, to try and learn about the world. Apparently, magic is widespread, almost everyone has at least some skill in it. There are, also, in fact many many races. Nia, the fox, for instance was a sub-specie of the Beast-kin race. There we also the ones you expected, such as Elf, Dwarf, etc. And a couple you didn't expect, such as Draco-kin, too proud to call themselves a sub-specie, they had outright denounced the race of Beast-kin. Giants, Gnomes, Fairies, etc. All in all a LOT of variety in this world.

After a while of traveling, you realize something. Since you can't check your skills for a proper description, you need to...experiment. Deciding now was as good as any, you focus on Nia and a bar appears above her, though it says 'Impossible' instead of a %. But the fact that a bar even appeared is kind of strange...After a few seconds, you check with Adam, the human. A bar appears above him as well, but this one says 0%. So, you CAN tame people? Then why is Nia 'Impossible'? Perhaps it's based on how strong they are?

Around this time, Nia gasps in surprise, looking to the side and asking Adam to stop the wagon. Upon doing so he asks what's wrong. She points out a white spot on the side of the road. It seems to be a fox-like creature with pure white fur. She mentions that it looks like a rare snow kitsune, a rather rare monster.

After a little while observing it, she seems to have an idea. Turning to you, she asks if you could tame it for them, as payment, of sorts, for taking you to town. Agreeing, you start taming. The bar appearing and increasing. Much slower than Minnie's did. Taming speed has to have something to do with strength or rarity, or both.

Around 50% you decide to try something. Getting off the wagon, to the protests of Nia and Adam, worried you'll scare the creature away, you carefully walk towards it. It notices you and drops into a defensive stance, not looking scared, but not being friendly. But not aggressive either. Stopping, you try to talk to it, let it know you aren't there to hurt it.

This seems to work, as you had hoped. It seems that the more you've tamed something, the more friendly it becomes to you. At 60%, you manage to sit down relatively close to it, and start chatting. You learn that it is a young kit, lost after being chased away from it's home on a nearby mountain by really aggressive monsters. at 80%, you offer to help it get back to it's family, if it agrees to travel with you as your companion. It's initially unwilling, but as you talk, and get to know each other a bit better, it eventually decides it's worth it, to see if it's family is safe. Upon agreeing, it's progress jumps to 99%! Apparently, if they agree to the taming, it skips whatever happened to Minnie.

Asking her gender, to avoid name issues, you find that they're female, just like Minnie. Giving her the name Yuki, Japanese for snow, an elegant sounding name, better than actually calling her snow, or snowflake, or something equally meh sounding you take her back to the pair. You apologize, explaining that you don't want to give Yuki to them, it'd feel wrong after you talked so long, you feel quite attached. But promise to tame them whatever else they want if they see something else. After the obvious disappointment, they agree to your terms, and allow you back on.

About an hour later, you all stop for a break. They offer you some food and drink, of which you readily partake. After a little while, you start to feel unusually tired, eventually passing out.

After an indeterminate amount of time, you awaken to find yourself in rags, and locked in a cage. It looks like those two betrayed you! But to what end? What now?
15111.title: Hail them, see if they'll give you a ride.

choices: Try to figure out a way to escape.
Wait, and hope it's just a prank, or something.
151111.content:
Note: Since I've made it obvious that taming can be used on people at this point, I'll explain it a bit here, in case someone decides to keep this story rolling. Along with another note that I feel is needed.

First: It's effectiveness is based on the total strength of the target. Nia, for instance, was a bit too strong, and thus 'Impossible'.

Second: 'Impossible' doesn't mean literally un-tamable, you can still tame such a creature, but it's thousands of times slower than it normally would be. Something that'd take a few minutes to tame, might take weeks, or months, even years, depending on how strong they are. Obviously not a feasible option.

Third: Once tamed, a mark appears on the body somewhere, and the fur/skin color changes slightly to differentiate that particular creature from others of it's kind. It's a small change, barely noticeable.

Fourth: When taming, you are able to check the stats of the target when it gets to 50% or higher.

Fifth: After taming, you can telepathically communicate with your 'Pets', and get a general idea of where they are, even if they're miles away.

Sixth: Taming something does not make them mindlessly obedient. They won't go against your commands, but they won't just 'Yes, master.' if you ask them to do something, you have to make it a command, or they need to like you well enough to do it. You can turn on 'mindless' mode while taming, though, the target essentially loses consciousness and is 100% obedient, their personality is also completely repressed. You can switch tames between the two modes. They don't remember anything that happens while in this state.

Seventh: You can change the effectiveness of the taming by 'directing it' while taming. When taming, you are basically using magic to coax the target's mind into becoming yours. While doing so, if you focus on doing it a certain way, it will change the process. You can attempt to speed it up, but they have more of a chance to notice something's wrong, and it's not instant, so if they're tough, you might not get away with it. Or, you can go slower, more delicately. They most likely won't notice at all, but it could take a pretty good amount of time. Going fast also causes headaches, and sometimes brain damage. If you push too hard, they might lose their mind and personality completely and be irreversibly stuck in 'Mindless Mode'.

Finally, about Skill Evolution: Basically, the skills you have get stronger, the more you use them, or learn about them, and when they meet certain criteria, they 'evolve' and change. The change is based on your perception of the skill. For instance, Taming, has actually already 'evolved'. You've, at this point, tamed a creature, and learned about the skill, and while doing so, you were thinking about using it to tame lots of things. Not just monsters. The interpretation of 'Creature' is pretty loose, as such, a 'Person' is also a type of 'Creature' leading your taming skill to evolve to also effect 'people' and not just monsters and animals. Essentially this is a deus ex machina skill, it's that one OP ability I gave 'myself' for this story. It can lead to you becoming ridiculously overpowered, as your strength becomes 'Godlike', your intelligence becomes 'Omniscient', and your magic becomes 'Omnipotent'. So don't use this too often. It'd get a bit boring fast. A skill can not, however, just suddenly become OP, it goes through stages, like levels, and get multiple evolutions. So, you can evolve a skill, get better at it, things like that, but don't go too crazy too fast.

These are the 'rules' I use for this story of mine. Now that I've built this world as much as I have, if you continue, you'll need to keep these in mind.

Now, what to do about your current situation?

info.brief_description: Anything your hearts could desire. Kinda like a genie, in story form. What do You Wish?
info.description:
This story is whatever you want it to be, I will be watching this grow (hopefully). I've decided to let anyone add anytime, anywhere.

A few rules:
1) try to keep cussing down to a maximum of 10-15 cuss words a page. (preferably less.)
2) no being mean to anyone who adds to this story.
3) if I miss an option that you know and you want to add it, I'll have other options on almost every page, just be sure to leave an option for someone else to add theirs if they need too.
4) and try not to write so bad that no one can understand you, if I have to I'll re-write the chapter so people can understand it easier.
But other than that...just enjoy.

I'll watch for problems in chapters, and might add every now and then...but still, I don't care too much what you add.
(P.S. If anyone was wondering, yes, my anything also includes scenes from animes/mangas and anything else, but you'll have to use the quick story option.)

EDIT: I've noticed that people are taking the 'Wish' part of my title literally. While that's perfectly fine, I want to make clear that you don't have to make your story a wishing simulator.

You want to be a normal person, and simulate what you'd do if you found yourself in a certain situation? Go ahead.

You want to be a mad scientist cloning sex slaves for some reason (like porn related world domination)? A-OK

You want to be the demon lord of the 9th Neko dimension bent of the destruction of all teddy bears for whatever reason? Have at it.

Just follow the rules (I know it's hard, there's like...3 of 'em :P) and you can do whatever 'You Wish'.
